author: JuliaRegistrator

comments.body:
Your `new package` pull request does not meet the guidelines for auto-merging. Please make sure that you have read the [General registry README](https://github.com/JuliaRegistries/General/blob/master/README.md) and the [AutoMerge guidelines](https://juliaregistries.github.io/RegistryCI.jl/stable/guidelines/). The following guidelines were not met:

- Name is not at least 5 characters long
- Package name similar to 14 existing packages.
  <details>
  <summary>Similar package names</summary>

  1. Similar to Bio. Damerau-Levenshtein distance 2 is at or below cutoff of 2.
  2. Similar to Git. Damerau-Levenshtein distance 2 is at or below cutoff of 2.
  3. Similar to Amb. Damerau-Levenshtein distance 2 is at or below cutoff of 2.
  4. Similar to ASE. Damerau-Levenshtein distance 2 is at or below cutoff of 2.
  5. Similar to Ant. Damerau-Levenshtein distance 2 is at or below cutoff of 2.
  6. Similar to Avro. Damerau-Levenshtein distance 2 is at or below cutoff of 2.
  7. Similar to AES. Damerau-Levenshtein distance 2 is at or below cutoff of 2.
  8. Similar to Fire. Damerau-Levenshtein distance 2 is at or below cutoff of 2.
  9. Similar to AMD. Damerau-Levenshtein distance 2 is at or below cutoff of 2.
  10. Similar to Tar. Damerau-Levenshtein distance 2 is at or below cutoff of 2.
  11. Similar to ADI. Damerau-Levenshtein distance 2 is at or below cutoff of 2.
  12. Similar to AWS. Damerau-Levenshtein distance 2 is at or below cutoff of 2.
  13. Similar to LiBr. Damerau-Levenshtein distance 2 is at or below cutoff of 2.
  14. Similar to Fri. Damerau-Levenshtein distance 2 is at or below cutoff of 2.

  </details>


Note that the guidelines are only required for the pull request to be merged automatically. However, it is **strongly recommended** to follow them, since otherwise the pull request needs to be manually reviewed and merged by a human.

After you have fixed the AutoMerge issues, simple retrigger Registrator, which will automatically update this pull request. You do not need to change the version number in your `Project.toml` file (unless of course the AutoMerge issue is that you skipped a version number, in which case you should change the version number).

If you do not want to fix the AutoMerge issues, please post a comment explaining why you would like this pull request to be manually merged.

Since you are registering a new package, please make sure that you have also read the package naming guidelines: https://julialang.github.io/Pkg.jl/dev/creating-packages/#Package-naming-guidelines-1



---
If you want to prevent this pull request from being auto-merged, simply leave a comment. If you want to post a comment without blocking auto-merging, you must include the text `[noblock]` in your comment.
<!-- [noblock] -->
<!---
this_is_the_single_automerge_comment
--->

Hello. I would like to register this package. It seems that the only issue is that the name is short (Air.jl) and additionally is similar to other packages with short names. I am okay with this and would like to register it anyway.
Some context: Air stands for **A**tomic **I**mmutables **R**esource—it's a toolbox for using persistent (immutable) data structures and [STM](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Software_transactional_memory) in Julia. The data structures are functionally similar to those in the old `FunctionalCollections` repository (which I believe is no longer maintained), but they have been rewritten from the ground-up. The STM resources in Air let you compose arbitrary thread-safe atomic operations on immutable data.
Air is also a nice poetic name that captures something about the feel of the library that isn't particularly quantifiable—similar to libraries like [Avalon](https://github.com/JuliaRegistries/General/tree/master/A/Avalon) and [Fire](https://github.com/JuliaRegistries/General/tree/master/F/Fire).
Thanks!
An unexpected error occurred during registration.

- Description: Light-weight functional collections and utilities for Julia.

title: New package: Air v0.1.1
